titlestmt.titleproper: John A. Hartford Foundation records, Grants, Series 5
A Guide to the John A. Hartford Foundation records, Grants, Series 5 FA1297

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-10-31 00:08:21 -0400.

did.unittitle: John A. Hartford Foundation records, Grants, Series 5

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The John A. Hartford Foundation records are currently being processed (2016-2018). Additional records will be made available for research and added to DIMES as the project progresses.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The John A. Hartford Foundation records were donated to RAC by JAHF in 2014. Record transfers to RAC began in 2014 and continue as needed.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC has legal title, copyright, and literary rights to the collection in so far as it holds them. RAC has authority to grant permission to publish.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The John A. Hartford Foundation (JAHF) was established in 1929 by brothers John and George Hartford, sons of the founder of the Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Company (A&P). The foundation is a private, nonpartisan philanthropy dedicated to improving the care of older adults. For its first several decades, the foundation broadly supported clinical medical research. By 1982, it began to focus solely on geriatric healthcare. In 2015, JAHF paid out $20.2 million on a total of 80 active grants and committed $25.3 million to 24 new grants projects, all focused on the care of older adults.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: For Series 1 of the John A. Hartford Foundation records, see http://dimes.rockarch.org/FA771/collection
For Series 2 of the John A. Hartford Foundation records, see http://dimes.rockarch.org/FA1137/collection
For Series 3 of the John A. Hartford Foundation records, see http://dimes.rockarch.org/FA1218/collection
For Series 4 of the John A. Hartford Foundation records, see http://dimes.rockarch.org/FA1296/collection
For Series 6 of the John A. Hartford Foundation records, see http://dimes.rockarch.org/FA1326/collection
For Series 7 of the John A. Hartford Foundation records, see http://dimes.rockarch.org/FA1138/collection

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains grant files and associated administrative records from 1992 to 2015 including but not limited to: proposals, award letters, progress reports, correspondence and budget files.
